title: Clams and Mussels Posillipo
titleAlternative: Vongole e Cozze in Salsa Piccante
introduction: Clams and Mussels Posillipo is a hearty dish that combines fresh clams and mussels with a spicy tomato sauce. Named after the charming point of land on the Bay of Naples, this dish is a nod to traditional Italian-American cuisine. Serve it over toasted Italian bread or freselle for a complete meal that's full of flavor.
ingredients: 1 (28-ounce) can peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
Italian bread slices, toasted, or freselle
instructions: 1. Soak the clams and mussels in cold water for 30 minutes. Scrub the clams under cold running water with a stiff brush. Cut or pull off the beards from the mussels. Discard any clams or mussels with cracked shells or those that refuse to close tightly when touched.

2. Pour the olive oil into a large heavy pot. Add the garlic and crushed red pepper. Cook over medium heat until the garlic is lightly golden, about 2 minutes. Add the white wine and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the tomatoes, oregano, and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a simmer and cook for 15 minutes.
3. Add the clams and mussels to the pot and cover tightly. Cook until the shells open, about 5 minutes.
4. Place slices of Italian bread in the bottom of 4 pasta bowls. Spoon on the clams and mussels. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately.
